src:
Mye halleluja fra nyfrelste Kanye West
Kanye West er nyfrelst. Det blir det helt ok musikk av.
03 Nov 2019, 10:35 by Stella Marie Brevik



1 2 3 4 5 6
Kanye West: «Jesus is King» (Def Jam)
Jeg havner ofte i opphetede diskusjoner om Kanye West og om hvorvidt rapperen er et musikalsk geni. Folket er delt. Jeg har stått fast på at mannen er eksentrisk, men like fullt et geni. Nå er jeg ikke like sikker.
West har satt sine spor på populærkulturen og skapt banebrytende musikk siden 2004. Nå tar han steget fra rap til kristen-rap. I utgangspunktet er sjangerbyttet intet problem, men overgangen blir smertefullt brå. Noen låter føles for cocky og banale; han er ikke redd for å si se-på-meg-jeg-har-skjønt-det. Det kan bli for mye halleluja.
Samtidig har han laget album som reflekterer omkring raseskiller, kjendisliv, sosiale medier og skinnhellige mennesker: Said I'm gonna do a gospel album, what have you been hearin' from the Christians? They'll be the first one to judge me.
Albumet er eksperimentelt i sann Kanye-stil. Musikken stiller viktige spørsmål, og gospelmusikken er tidvis en fryd for sjelen, men deler av platen faller fort i den nyfrelste klisjégryta.
Beste spor: «Hands On», «Water».
text:
Lots of hallelujah from the newly saved Kanye West
Kanye West is newly saved. It will be totally ok music.
03 Nov 2019, 10:35 by Stella Marie Brevik



1 2 3 4 5 6
Kanye West: "Jesus Is King" (Def Jam)
I often get into heated discussions about Kanye West and whether the rapper is a musical genius. The people are divided. I've been adamant that the man is eccentric, but just as full a genius. Now I'm not so sure.
West has left his mark on popular culture and created groundbreaking music since 2004. Now he is moving from rap to Christian rap. Initially, the genre change is no problem, but the transition becomes painfully abrupt. Some songs feel too cocky and banal; he is not afraid to say look-at-me-I-have-though. It can be too much hallelujah.
At the same time, he has created albums that reflect on racial divides, celebrities, social media and skin-saints: Said I'm gonna do a gospel album, what have you been hearing from the Christians? They'll be the first one to judge me.
The album is experimental in true Kanye style. The music asks important questions, and the gospel music is sometimes a delight to the soul, but parts of the record fall quickly into the newly released cliché pot.
Best tracks: "Hands On", "Water".
